image.altText: Two men in suits outside a sandstone building.

props.synopsis: Eric Abetz takes over as treasurer, while Bridget Archer is given the health portfolio, as Jeremy Rockliff reveals his cabinet picks for Tasmania's next government.Â

title.children: Abetz and Archer in, Barnett and Jaensch out as Rockliff cabinet revealed

image.altText: A man with dark hair, wearing a blue suit and red-tie speaks to media

props.synopsis: Tasmanian politics remains extremely turbulent as Labor leader Dean Winter fights to convince the crossbench to support a fresh no-confidence motion.

title.children: This time Winter eyes government instead of just toppling a leader

image.altText: An elderly couple with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: The couple missing since Saturday on a flight from Tasmania to New South Wales with their dog have been named by Tasmania Police.

title.children: Couple aboard missing flight from Tasmania identified

image.altText: A large circular CSIRO logo on the side of a building.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO is facing hundreds more cuts to staff, after more than 400 jobs were slashed last year, the union has warned.

title.children: Possibility of hundreds of job cuts 'unsettling' for CSIRO staff

image.altText: A rocky granite island in the ocean.

props.synopsis: When Tasmania broke away from New South Wales politically in the 19th century it was decided all islands south of Wilsons Promontory would belong to the new colony, but it didn't quite work out that way.

title.children: Charting bungle created 'land border' between Tasmania and Victoria

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at podium in White House

props.synopsis: Texas is the site of a massive political showdown that could have a direct influence on US President Donald Trump's ability to continue his agenda. Here's a basic breakdown of what's going on.

title.children: A showdown in Texas could shape the future of Trump's presidency

image.altText: Anthony Albanese G7

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese confirms he's making a trip to New Zealand this weekend to take part in annual leaders' talks with Prime Minister Christopher Luxon in Queenstown. Follow live.

title.children: PM to visit New Zealand on weekend for leaders' talks in Queenstown

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A little bit of tax chat
PM says government has been 'very clear' on negative gearing
Calls for housing tax shake-up 'absolute garbage': Bragg

image.altText: Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: The government is trying to strike the right balance between preventing mass redundancies forced by AI, while also preventing Australia falling behind those countries rapidly embracing the technology.

title.children: Jim Chalmers is pitching himself as a Goldilocks on artificial intelligence

image.altText: An ASX sign

props.synopsis: Shares in the stock exchange operator slump a day after an embarrassing bungle involving TPG, as ASIC considers approving a competitor. Australian stocks open lower, despite Wall Street gaining as Apple shares climbed. Follow live.

title.children: Shares in ASX slump as rival exchange operator closes in on approval

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia's trade goes for gold in June
ASIC 'enhancing competition' as it considers approving ASX rival
ASX shares slump as stock exchange competition from Cboe looms large

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man with blue eyes, wearing a light-coloured shirt as he walks out of court.

props.synopsis: The jury has heard of secret recordings and Matt Wright pressuring an injured pilot to doctor flight logs in the Netflix star's criminal trial, with the defence now taking the stand. Follow live.

title.children: 'Just torch it': Jury hears of secret recording of Netflix star after fatal crash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Dani doesn't need to see what's on that'
Mick Burns fights back tears recalling crash scene

image.altText: Tristan Sernson, Super Young co-founder

props.synopsis: Cryotherapy, infant stem cells, extreme cold, IV infusions, red light therapy, blue light therapy â¦ more Australians are paying big bucks to buy into a "longevity" industry worth an estimated $2.5 trillion globally â and that has some traditional doctors worried.

title.children: The longevity movement is growing, but doctors warn consumers to be cautious

image.altText: Man uses his phone to pay at a teller.

props.synopsis: Experts warn the Reserve Bank's proposal to end card surcharges to save consumers money could have unintended consequences.

title.children: What it will really cost consumers if the RBA scraps card surcharges

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: The federal government is working to shield Australia from Donald Trump's potential tariffs, but the peak pharmaceutical industry body argues there's a bigger issue closer to home.

title.children: Health minister 'concerned' about Trump tariffs but some warn of a bigger issue

image.altText: A graphic shows a pregnant woman and two police officers behind police tape and lights

props.synopsis: Police responses to family violence are too often harming not helping victims, replicating the power and control dynamics that underpin abuse and increasing risk, trauma and feelings of powerlessness, new research has found.

title.children: Police too often increase family violence risk and harm, new research finds

image.altText: A close up of Cassandra Goldie in parliament house.

props.synopsis: The Australian Council of Social Services has thrown its weight behind calls to wind back property investor tax breaks, setting up a potential housing flashpoint ahead of the government's economic round table next fortnight.

title.children: Welfare groups join push to tackle negative gearing, CGT concessions

image.altText: An Aboriginal girl with black curly hair tied in an updo, big red circular earrings, butterfly pattern top holding microphone.

props.synopsis: Bununggu and Warraingu model Cindy Rostron is named one of the industry's rising stars in this year's National Indigenous Fashion Awards.

title.children: From 'bush girl' to Vogue, Cindy Rostron is a rising star in Australian fashion

image.altText: Side view of unidentified youth.

props.synopsis: The death has prompted calls from advocates for Queensland's child protection inquiry to investigate.

title.children: Boy's suicide should 'jolt' child safety into action, advocates say

image.altText: The entry sign at the Mounties club.

props.synopsis: The first licensed club group targeted by the nation's financial crimes intelligence agency is accused of turning over almost $140 million from 10 gamblers considered high risk of money laundering and counter terrorism financing.

title.children: $140m gambled using allegedly dirty money at NSW pokies group Mounties

image.altText: Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin delivers a Welcome To Country

props.synopsis: Wurundjeri Woi-wurrung elder Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin has said she will attend Thursday night's Melbourne Storm home game despite ongoing concerns with the club's board.Â

title.children: Wurundjeri elder Aunty Joy to attend Storm NRL match despite ongoing issues with board

image.altText: Cockatoo dancing

props.synopsis: Cockatoos can head-bang, body roll and side-step intentionally to music according to a new study. One bird recorded 257 dance moves while listening to music for 20 minutes.Â

title.children: Cockatoos that feel the beat have distinct dance moves, study shows

image.altText: A firefighter spraying water from a hose at bright orange flames erupting from the windows of a white weatherboard home

props.synopsis: Poor air quality, health care delays and a surge in suicides are blamed for hundreds of deaths following large-scale bushfires in Los Angeles and Hawaii.

title.children: LA fires officially killed 30, but new research puts death toll at more than 400

image.altText: X-ray image of a bird with a hook inside it's belly

props.synopsis: The juvenile cassowary was spotted with a fishing line hanging from its mouth in Far North Queensland and later died.Â

title.children: Death of young cassowary that ingested fish hook prompts fresh warnings

image.altText: Woodside's offshore North Rankin gas platform at sunset.

props.synopsis: The oil and gas company has been told to cease decommissioning operations at two WA gas fields due to preventable safety incidents.

title.children: Woodside defends safety culture after 'deluge' of dangerous incidents

image.altText: Author John Boyne, wearing a beige suit and white shirt, sitting on a stool with his hands clasped together

props.synopsis: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas author's latest work, The Elements, is a series of four linked stories examining child abuse from different perspectives.

title.children: Irish author John Boyne was abused as a child. He says writing helped him heal

image.altText: A digital render of a white suspension bridge extending across deep blue waters

props.synopsis: The Meloni government has cleared the way to build a $24-billion suspension bridge, which would link the mainland with Sicily.

title.children: Italy greenlights world's longest suspension bridge to Sicily

image.altText: A man standing in front of a TV screen in a blue shirt

props.synopsis: The girl's father says he felt like he "died inside" when the childcare centre phoned to say an educator had "used legs to kick" his daughter.

title.children: Dad 'died inside' when child care called to say worker had assaulted child

image.altText: A woman and a man stand in front of a smashed floating Arc de Triomphe in video game Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

props.synopsis: In his first-ever video game soundtrack, Lorien Testard created the music for hit game Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. It's topped charts and racked up millions of streams.

title.children: An unknown composer posted his music online and scored the biggest indie game of the year

image.altText: Along brown sign saying "WELCOME TO FORT STEWART, GEORGIA" with multiple logos.

props.synopsis: An Army sergeant has opened fire at a military base in Georgia, shooting and wounding five soldiers and prompting a brief lockdown at one of America's largest Army bases.

title.children: US Army sergeant shoots 5 fellow soldiers in Georgia

image.altText: A man holding a gold nugget

props.synopsis: A Victorian prospector has literally struck gold while making a tutorial video on the subject in WA's Goldfields, unearthing a 7-ounce nugget.

title.children: Prospector in awe after digging up $40k gold nugget on camera

image.altText: Hand holding small red-brown rock with a fine point next to other sharp stones.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists discovered stone tools at least a million years old on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi, but exactly who made them and how they got there is unknown.

title.children: Million-year-old tools found in Sulawesi made by mystery human

image.altText: GettyImages-2227989185

props.synopsis: Elina Svitolina calls out the "shameful" hate messages she received after a loss in the Canadian Open, pointing the finger at gambling.

title.children: Ukrainian tennis star hits out at 'shameful' online hate messages after loss

image.altText: A four-wheel drive with police decals and lights outside a house

props.synopsis: Domestic violence support advocates say reaching isolated towns to help victim-survivors can be a challenge, following a murder-suicide at Bordertown.

title.children: 'Devastating' murder-suicide prompts calls for more help in isolated areas

image.altText: Finalists of a tennis tournament pose with the trophies at the end of the match

props.synopsis: Prize money at the US Open will rise to nearly $US85 million ($130 million) across all competitions.

title.children: US Open prize money increases to nearly $US85 million

image.altText: An artist in front of a gold balloon sculpture.

props.synopsis: The piece by American artist Jeff Koons â Balloon Venus Dolni Vestonice (Yellow), 2013â17 â is a nearly three-metre-tall polished stainless steel statue.

title.children: This balloon sculpture could be the national gallery's priciest gift
